description: A comprehensive program preparing students for the digital age through rigorous study of contemporary online phenomena and digital communication.

courses.name: Introduction to WiFi Fundamentals
courses.description: Learn the ancient art of troubleshooting your router. Topics include: turning it off and on again, checking if cables are plugged in, and the philosophical implications of 'no internet connection.'

courses.name: Basic Meme Literacy
courses.description: An introductory survey of meme formats from 2005-present. Students will learn to identify vintage memes, understand cultural context, and avoid being 'cringe.'

courses.name: Professional Procrastination
courses.description: Master the art of productive procrastination. Includes study of tab management, strategic reddit browsing, and advanced YouTube recommendation algorithms.

courses.name: Advanced Meme Theory
courses.description: Deep dive into meme economics, viral coefficients, and the lifecycle of trending topics. Laboratory component includes creating original content and surviving the comments section.

courses.name: Social Media Doomscrolling
courses.description: Scientific exploration of infinite scroll mechanisms and their effects on dopamine receptors. Hands-on experience with all major platforms required.

courses.name: Email Etiquette & Reply-All Prevention
courses.description: Critical study of when to use CC vs BCC, appropriate use of exclamation points, and the existential dread of 'per my last email.'

courses.name: Advanced Coffee Studies
courses.description: Comprehensive analysis of caffeine delivery systems optimized for remote work. Includes espresso machine maintenance and Zoom-safe mug selection.

courses.name: Influencer Marketing & Strategic Selfies
courses.description: Master the golden ratio of hashtags, optimal lighting conditions, and filter selection theory. Final project: achieve verified status on at least one platform.

courses.name: Password Management & Security Theater
courses.description: Learn to create passwords you'll immediately forget. Topics include: 'Password123!', two-factor authentication anxiety, and security question philosophy.

courses.name: Dark Mode Aesthetics
courses.description: Exploration of dark mode across platforms and its impact on perceived productivity. Lab sessions conducted exclusively at night.

courses.name: Algorithm Appeasement Strategies
courses.description: Advanced techniques for gaming recommendation algorithms and avoiding social media jail. Includes study of shadowban detection and engagement metrics.

courses.name: Chrome Tab Management at Scale
courses.description: Managing 47+ open tabs without crashing your browser. Topics include: tab grouping, session management, and coming to terms with memory leaks.

courses.name: Emoji Linguistics & Unicode Politics
courses.description: Scholarly examination of emoji evolution, cross-platform rendering inconsistencies, and the generational divide in 😂 vs 💀 usage.

courses.name: Professional GIF Selection
courses.description: Curating the perfect GIF response for every workplace scenario. Emphasis on Slack etiquette and appropriate reaction timing.

courses.name: Zoom Fatigue Studies
courses.description: Anthropological study of remote meeting culture. Master the art of the strategic mute, virtual background selection, and looking engaged while multitasking.

courses.name: Internet Drama & Discourse Analysis
courses.description: Advanced study of Twitter threads, ratio dynamics, and quote-tweet strategies. Students must successfully navigate at least one controversy without getting cancelled.

courses.name: Online Shopping Cart Abandonment
courses.description: Psychology of wishlist curation, waiting for sales, and the spiritual practice of 'just browsing.' Final exam: resist Black Friday impulse purchases.

courses.name: Capstone: Building Your Personal Brand
courses.description: Synthesize all learning into a cohesive online presence. Create a LinkedIn profile that makes you sound more impressive than you are. Graduate-level impostor syndrome included.

courses.name: Thesis: Digital Detox Impossibility
courses.description: Comprehensive research project examining why you can't actually quit social media no matter how many times you've threatened to delete everything.
